Rambler Family,

On Thursday, April 2, Governor Whitmer provided an Executive Order that mandated the closure of all Michigan schools for the remainder of the school year.

We understand the hardship this closure puts on our families, as well as the social and emotional impact it may have on our students. This school closure will obviously raise many questions for students and families. Please know that our administration and staff have been working closely together the past weeks and continue to do so, in order to answer these questions and move our district forward. More information will be available for you in the coming days. We will continue to work together to care for each other, our students, and our community.

Our staff remains dedicated to our students and the McBain Rural Agricultural School District Family. We are committed to ensuring supports for our students and families are in place so that our students continue learning during this school closure.

We are here for you!

With Love and Care,
Your McBain Rambler Administration and Staff

Good afternoon,

This message is to inform you of our current situation regarding sickness in our buildings. Just over 15% of our population has been absent today. But, our elementary and middle schools have higher percentages than that, with the elementary at almost 20% absent. One elementary classroom had only 10 students in it.

Taking into consideration all of the information on student attendance, trends, staff coverage and the quality of learning at this point, I have decided to cancel school for Thursday, February 6th and Friday, February 7th. The health department recommends that if school is called off, it is done for a minimum of 4 calendar days. There will be no practices, activities or any use of our facilities this Thursday through Sunday. This is also a good time to remind parents that it is best to stay home and rest during this time off and to try to stay away from large groups of people. Our staff will be cleaning and sanitizing while our building is vacant.

Thank you and be healthy.

Superintendent Steve Prissel
